ygData.subject: Re: Upgrade Completed
ygData.msgSnippet: Lady Hawk eyed Zardus up and down. I was beginning to think you didn t like me anymore. the sarcastic femm said thinking how nice he d look bowing at her

Lady Hawk eyed Zardus up and down. "I was beginning to think you didn't like
me anymore." the sarcastic femm said thinking how nice he'd look bowing at
her feat like the pathetic dog he was.

------------------------------------------
Najah just couldn't help hissing in the last word.  "It wasssss a
pleassssure keep an
eye on her, we're becoming firendssss, aren't we parrot? By the way
sssssir If you like ssskin her alive you jusst have to tell me... cya
parrot!!! good luck, bossy-hawk... you will need it"

Lady Hawk looked back and with a sure of herself attitude replied "Don't
worry worm, we'll get together and go fishing when this is over, you can be
the bait."


----- Original Message -----
From: <Yanshosh@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, March 04, 2001 2:37 PM
Subject: Re: Upgrade Completed


> ::Zardus::
>
> Zardus stops, seeing Lady Hawk in the corridors walking with Najah.
> He approaches the two.
>
> "Thank you for keeping an eye on Lady Hawk, Najah," Zardus says, "I
> will need to speak to her alone now. You may go get some rest if you
> want."
>
>
>
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > This post makes Zardus sound very powerful, but I won't RP him to
> be
> > this strong. He'll be well within power limits.
> >
> >
> > ::Zardus::
> >
> > 'Awake.'
> >
> > Zardus slowly opened his eyes, looking up at the cealing. For a few
> > seconds he had no idea who or where he was, but slowly his data
> > tracks activated and he remembered that the Vok had made him go to
> > this lab for an upgrade. The upgrade must have been completed and
> the
> > machine that he had been in must have edjected him out, because he
> > was laying on his back on a table in the middle of the lab. But
> then,
> > he might have walked there and the Vok could have cleared that
> > knowledge. Zardus groaned and sat up, rubbing his head with a hand.
> > It was simply a reflexive action, though, as he felt perfectly
> fine.
> > He froze, seeing his arm.
> >
> > It was slightly bigger, still black, but with several red spots on
> > it. One was on the back of his wrist, where his wrist computer was.
> > There were two spots beside that on the sides of his wrist, and he
> > knew that there were two mini missile launchers that could emerge
> > from both spots. The launchers would shoot missiles that were like
> > FZ's: shielded against lasers and energy draining. They were small,
> > manueverable, and fast, but they did not leave a draining field
> like
> > his clone's. These ones only worked if they hit, but they worked
> more
> > effectively. The orb was still burned into the palm of that hand,
> > showing both out of the back of the hand and out of the front,
> making
> > his hand a bit see-through.
> >
> > Zardus blinked, looking over his body. He was definately bigger. He
> > estimated that he would be approaching thirteen feet now, instead
> of
> > the eleven and a half that he used to be. The upgrade was obviously
> > more for efficiency than looks, because Zardus was almost identical
> > to his old self. Other than the red spots on some weapon spaces and
> > the size increase, he was still covered with his beast mode
> feathers,
> > and they still formed an extremely durable armor. In addition to
> the
> > jetpack on his back, jets were attached to his calves to give him
> > extra speed in the air. He looked at his right arm and issued a
> > mental command. The bottom of his wrist opened and a large device
> > rotated down out of it, moving upward untill his hand was around a
> > handle and trigger. The device looked like:
> >
> >         Side view:                  Top View:
> >           ____
> >          /   |                       _|_
> >         -    |  )                   |___|
> >         =---------+                 \ . /
> >                                     (___)
> >                                       X
> >
> >         Legend:                     Legend:
> >
> >        -, = Guns                  | Guns
> >        ) Trigger/handle           . Trigger/handle
> >        + Attachment to wrist      X Attachment to wrist
> >
> > The device was a high-accuracy weapon. The side two guns both shot
> > lasers, while the middle one shot a small missile with a highly-
> > explosive shell. There were two cameras in the spaces between the
> > guns so that the screen that was in front of Zardus's hand, on the
> > back wall of the weapon, displayed a depth-preceptive image of the
> > area. The screen could zoom in and out to provide for better
> aiming.
> > Three crosshairs represented the aim of the three guns. With
> another
> > mental command, the weapon folded back into his wrist.
> >
> > "All systems online," Zardus said without really knowing why, but
> the
> > effect surprised him. He felt his optics charge as the laser-firing
> > systems that were in them activated, but the real improvement was
> the
> > scanners. He could detect the area around him much better than in
> his
> > old body, able to locate most of the bots in the Iron Fist without
> > any external aid. Two guns emerged from his shoulders, aiming ahead
> > of him. They could both fire highly-charged plasma beams, but their
> > energy packs needed to be recharged fairly frequently. Scanning his
> > storage compartments, Zardus found that the only pieces of his old
> > equipment that he still had were his plasma launcher, some charges,
> > several pistols, and a dagger. Two swords were stored in his torso,
> > able to be charged with energy on command.
> >
> > Zardus knew that even with his advanced body, there were still many
> > bots on the planet that could prove an equal or a better to him. He
> > couldn't use all his weaponry in a battle, not without passing out
> > from lack of energy after firing so much, as most of the weapons
> were
> > charged on his body's energy. However, his new body placed him far
> > ahead of his old one, and he had no doubt that it would come in
> very
> > useful.
> >
> > 'I see you like my upgrade,' the Vok says in his head, causing
> Zardus
> > to look around needlessly. The Alliance commander powers down the
> > optic blasts and the shoulder cannons, the latter sliding back into
> > his shoulders.
> >
> > "Its new, yes," Zardus replies mentally, flexing his arms and
> testing
> > out the movement of his body. It was excellent.
> >
> > 'Good. Now go fulfill your task. You will have much trouble ahead,
> so
> > I give you permission to make alliances as you see fit. However,
> fail
> > and you will wish you had never crashed on this planet.'
> >
> > Zardus nods and walks out of the room, heading toward Najah and
> Lady
> > Hawk. Even though he had gone through an upgrade, he would still be
> > easilly recognizable as Commander Zardus.
>
>
>
>

>
>
